title: Tesla price target upped to $900 at B. of A. Securities
text: Analysts at B. of A. Securities on Tuesday tweaked their price target on Tesla Inc. TSLA, -0.07% stock to $900, from $800, ahead of the electric-car maker's third-quarter earnings on Wednesday.

title: Will Tesla Stock Rise Following Q3 2021 Earnings?
text: Tesla is expected to publish its Q3 2021 results after the markets close on Wednesday, October 20. The electric vehicle bellwether has already provided delivery figures for the quarter, noting that it sold a record 241,300 vehicles, marking a sequential increase of 20% and a year-over-year increase.

title: Tesla's Earnings: A Preview
text: Tesla(NASDAQ:TSLA) is set to give its latest quarterly earnings report on Wednesday, 2021-10-20. Here's what investors need to know before the announcement.

title: Tesla results will put China and supply chain in focus
text: Wednesday's corporate diary in London is relatively quiet, though one of the most followed stocks on both sides of the Atlantic is due to report later in the day: Tesla Inc. The latest news from Elon Musk's electric vehicles (EVs) and domestic battery storage company was that delivery numbers went up another gear in the third quarter, with 241,000 EVs shipped to customers.

title: Tesla Earnings: What to Look For
text: Tesla (TSLA) reports Q3 earnings after market close on October 20. Can it maintain strong earnings and revenue growth amid supply chain disruptions?

title: Tesla stock rises toward a 7th straight gain a day ahead of earnings report
text: Shares of Tesla Inc. TSLA, +3.21% rose 1.0% in premarket trading Tuesday, putting them on track to seek a seventh straight gain, a day before the electric vehicle maker is slated to report third-quarter results. The stock has run up 10.8% over the past six sessions to close Tuesday at the highest price since Feb. 2, and just 1.5% below the Jan. 26 record close of $883.09.

title: Tesla quarter may hinge on China factory, supply chain costs
text: Investors will be closely watching Tesla's quarterly results on Wednesday for indications of its performance in China, where the electric carmaker has posted robust sales in the face of negative publicity and a host of new domestic competitors.
